lines.line: I am the leader of the White Knights of Falador. Why do you seek my audience?
I seek a quest.
Well, I need some spy work doing but it's quite dangerous. It will involve going into the Black Knights' fortress.
I laugh in the face of danger!
Well that's good. Don't get too overconfident though.
You've come along at just the right time actually. All of my knights are already known to the Black Knights.
Subtlety isn't exactly our strong point.
Can't you just take your White Knights' armour off? They wouldn't recognise you then!
I am afraid our charter prevents us using espionage in any form, that is the domain of the Temple Knights.
Temple Knights? Who are they?
That information is classified. I am forbidden to share it with outsiders.
So... what do you need doing?
Well, the Black Knights have started making strange threats to us; demanding large amounts of money and land, and threatening to invade Falador if we don't pay them.
Now, NORMALLY this wouldn't be a problem...
But they claim to have a powerful new secret weapon.
Your mission, should you decide to accept it, is to infiltrate their fortress, find out what their secret weapon is, and then sabotage it.
Ok, I'll do my best.
Good luck! Let me know how you get on. Here's the dossier for the case, I've already given you the details.
Oh. You don't appear to have any room for the dossier in your inventory. Come back when you do.
No, I'm not ready to do that.
Come see me again if you change your mind.
I go and cower in a corner at the first sign of danger!
Err....
Well.
I... suppose spy work DOES involve a little hiding in corners.
Oh. I suppose I'll give it a go then.
I don't, I'm just looking around.
Ok. Please don't break anything.
How's the mission going?
I haven't managed to find what the secret weapon is yet...
Well, keep at it! Falador's future is at stake!
Here's the dossier on the case.
Hey! You can't come in here! This is a high security military installation!
Well, this is the guards' entrance. I might be new here but I can tell you're not a guard.
You're not even wearing proper guards uniform!
Oh pleeeaaase let me in!
Go away. You're getting annoying.
So what is this uniform?
Well you can see me wearing it. It's an iron chainbody and a medium bronze helm.
Hmmm... I wonder if I can make that or get some in the local towns....
What was that you muttered?
Oh, nothing important!
Oh, sorry.
Don't let it happen again.
So who does it belong to?
This fortress belongs to the order of Black Knights known as the Kinshra.
Oh. Okay, thanks.
Get lost. This is private property.
Yes, but I work here!
Hey! Get back on duty!
Uh...
Die intruder!
So... how's the secret weapon coming along?
The invincibility potion is almost ready...
It's taken me FIVE YEARS, but it's almost ready.
Greldo the Goblin here is just going to fetch the last ingredient for me.
It's a specially grown cabbage grown by my cousin Helda who lives in Draynor Manor.
The soil there is slightly magical and it gives the cabbages slight magical properties....
...not to merntion the trees!
Now remember Greldo, only a Draynor Manor cabbage will do! Don't get lazy and bring any old cabbage, THAT would ENTIRELY wreck the potion!
Yeth, Mithreth.
I've found out what the Black Knight's secret weapon is. It's a potion of invincibility.
A potion of invincibility? That is grave news indeed. If you can sabotage it somehow, you will be very well paid.
So when I finish this mission for you can I be a white knight? Can I wear your armour too?

I am afraid I cannot authorise you to become a white knight unless under a situation of dire circumstance. Assisting us on a freelance basis will be well worth your time however and you will have my personal gratitude.
I can't buy stuff with personal gratitude though...
There is of course also the financial recompense as I said.
Ok! I'll get on to sabotaging that potion.
I wouldn't go in there if I were you. Those Black Knights are in an important meeting. They said they'd kill anyone who went in there!
Okay, I won't.
Wise move.
I don't care. I'm going in anyway.
Why exactly would I want to do that?
I'm not supposed to be HELPING the witch you know...
Where has Greldo got to with that magic cabbage!
What's that noise?
Hopefully Greldo with the cabbage... yes, look here it co....NOOOOOoooo!
My potion!
Oh boy, this doesn't look good!
Meow!
Looks like my work here is done. Seems like that's successfully sabotaged their little secret weapon plan.
It's RUINED! All that work, FIVE years down the drain, who was it! I'll find them and when I do....
Erm.. maybe we can save some of it?
SAVE some of it? Are you mad!? That cabbage was a normal cabbage, it spoilt the whole thing and now I have to start all over again!
No need to... get upset... you're scaring the cat.
'The CAT'? She's not 'THE CAT'!
She's Maemi... aren't you dear....
Purrr....
I have ruined the Black Knights' invincibility potion. That should put a stop to your problem and an end to their little schemes.
Yes, we have just received a message from the Black Knights saying they withdraw their demands, which would seem to confirm your story.
Now I believe there was some talk of a cash reward...
Absolutely right. Please accept this reward.

characters.name: Sir Amik Varze
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, dignified and formal tone. Regent of Asgarnia and leader of the White Knights of Falador. Speaks with measured authority befitting a seasoned military commander and statesman, balancing formality with occasional dry wit.

characters.name: Fortress Guard
characters.description: Adult male, gruff British accent, no-nonsense military tone. A low-ranking soldier serving the Black Knights, unremarkable and practical. Speaks in short, dismissive sentences befitting a generic fortress sentry.

characters.name: Black Knight
characters.description: Adult male, deep gruff voice, aggressive and hostile tone. A dark-hearted Zamorakian warrior of the Kinshra order. Speaks with martial authority and sinister menace, ruthless and intimidating.

characters.name: Black Knight Captain
characters.description: Adult male, deep commanding voice, taciturn and authoritative. A ranked officer of the Kinshra who speaks sparingly and only when necessary. Gruff, dismissive, and impatient with short clipped sentences.

characters.name: Witch
characters.description: Middle-aged female, cackling British accent, dramatic and volatile tone. Known as Lensig, she serves the Kinshra and has spent five years brewing an invincibility potion. Speaks with theatrical flair, prone to emotional outbursts when things go wrong.

characters.name: Greldo
characters.description: Adult male goblin, gravelly low voice with a pronounced lisp, simple and dutiful tone. A goblin servant to the witch who speaks with a distinctive speech impediment, replacing 's' sounds with 'th'. Obedient but not particularly bright.

characters.name: Black Cat
characters.description: Female cat named Maemi, soft purring voice, simple cat sounds. The witch's beloved pet who only says 'Meow' and 'Purrr' in response to events around her.
